issue.title: Splitwise App
issue.body:
## Build expense-sharing app

**Features:**
- Google OAuth login
- Create groups, add expenses
- Split equally, view balances

**Tech:** Next.js 14, Tailwind, shadcn/ui, SQLite, NextAuth.js

**Pages:** Landing, Login, Dashboard, Group detail

ems.task: Create project foundation with Next.js 14 setup, including package.json with all dependencies (NextAuth, Google OAuth provider, better-sqlite3, shadcn/ui, Tailwind), tsconfig.json with strict mode, .gitignore for Next.js, and initialize basic project structure (app/ directory, components/, lib/, prisma/ for SQLite schema).
ems.error: No workers merged - all had conflicts

ems.task: Implement authentication system and database layer. Create NextAuth.js configuration with Google OAuth provider, design and implement SQLite database schema for users, groups, expenses, and balances using Prisma ORM. Build all database models, migrations, and seed data. Owns: lib/auth.ts, lib/prisma.ts, prisma/schema.prisma, app/api/auth/[...nextauth]/route.ts.

workers.task: Create Prisma schema with database models for User, Group, Expense, ExpenseSplit, and Balance. Initialize Prisma client and generate initial migration.
Implement NextAuth.js configuration with Google OAuth provider. Create authentication route handler and type definitions for auth session.
Create Prisma seed script with sample users, groups, expenses, and balance data for development testing.

ems.task: Build core application logic and API routes. Implement group creation/management, expense creation with equal splitting logic, balance calculation algorithms, and all CRUD operations. Create RESTful API endpoints for groups and expenses. Owns: app/api/groups/, app/api/expenses/, lib/calculations.ts, lib/actions.ts for server actions.

workers.task: Create database schema and setup. Initialize SQLite database with Prisma ORM. Define Group, Expense, and User models with relationships. Create database connection and migration scripts. Files: prisma/schema.prisma, lib/db.ts (database connection only), lib/prisma.ts (Prisma client singleton)

Implement balance calculation algorithms. Create pure functions for calculating equal splits, computing balances between users, and settling debts. Include zero-dependency business logic. Files: lib/calculations.ts

Create all API routes for groups and expenses. Implement RESTful endpoints in app/api/groups/route.ts (POST for create, GET for list), app/api/groups/[id]/route.ts (GET, PUT, DELETE), app/api/expenses/route.ts (POST for create, GET for list), app/api/expenses/[id]/route.ts (GET, PUT, DELETE). Each route uses calculations.ts and prisma.ts but does not modify them. Files: app/api/groups/route.ts, app/api/groups/[id]/route.ts, app/api/expenses/route.ts, app/api/expenses/[id]/route.ts

ems.task: Create all UI components and pages. Build landing page, login/logout flow, dashboard with group overview, group detail pages with expense lists and balance views. Integrate shadcn/ui components (Button, Card, Input, Dialog, etc.) with Tailwind styling. Owns: app/page.tsx, app/login/page.tsx, app/dashboard/page.tsx, app/group/[id]/page.tsx, components/ui/, components/expense-form.tsx, components/balance-card.tsx.

workers.task: Create landing page, login/logout page with Google OAuth UI, and shadcn/ui base components. Setup shadcn/ui configuration and install required UI components (Button, Card, Input, Dialog, Dropdown Menu, Avatar, Badge).
Create dashboard page with group overview, group card component, and navigation header. Implement dashboard layout with groups list, create group functionality, and user menu for logout.
Create group detail page with expense list, balance view, add expense functionality, and member management. Build expense card, balance summary card, and expense form dialog components.

analysisSummary: Build a complete expense-sharing application with Google OAuth authentication, group management, expense tracking, and balance calculations. Tech stack: Next.js 14, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui components, SQLite database, and NextAuth.js.
